Input:
As others have said, this tool works great.  It has plenty of weight so you get the job done quickly.  So far, I wash mine by hand, as I believe that's what was written on the packaging.  It only takes a minute to wash, so it's no problem at all.  I would like to add that the handle is firmly affixed too.

It has been used several times and still looks as good as new!

Input:
I've owned this knife for several years. It is a wonderful tool. I'll carry this with a good lock blade for heavy cutting tasks since I don't like slip locks for heavy cutting tasks. The onl thing this tool lacks is pliers.

I use the tools to
Large blade - general light duty cutting tasks
Small blade - small or detail cutting tasks
Scissors - so many different task, a very handy tool
Large flathead/bottle opener - screw driver and pry bar/opening  cold beverages
Small flathead/can opener - some use on the odd small screw job/second favorite tool
Tweezers - grabbing or picking up small things
Tooth pick - I use this to clean my nails or as a probe
Philips screw driver - not the most convenient position but you can generate a lot of power with it
Reamer - I've re-sized my belt with this and I enlarged the hole on my p-51 so it would fit my key ring
Parcel hook - I've never found a use for this and I've tried.
Key ring - THIS IS NOT A TOOL!

{"input": "Two months ago I couldn't even say \"Digital Camera\".  Like most everyone I searched for info on the internet.  After looking and studing for a couple of months I chose the Polaroid PDC 1100.  I have been extremely pleased.  Less than fifteen minutes out of the box I shots my first photos.  The camera is an excellent buy for the first time digital user.  Everything you need is included even the batteries.  The manual is concise and easy to understand.  The only reason I did not give the camera five stars is the software is not quite as powerful as I would liked to have seen.  I was not able to rename the .jpeg files to make them easier to use.  I did purchase another software...and it does everything I wanted, plus the other software had a...rebate so in essence it was free. The 1100 is an exceptional buy...from Polaroid (and) made my purchase a very pleasant experience.", "options": "[\"A: very positive\", \"B: positive\", \"C: neutral\", \"D: negative\", \"E: very negative\"]", "output": "B: positive"}

Input:
I've reviewed these Kreg screws in different sizes with the same results.

I've used these screws with my Kreg jig with good results. I've had no breakage, although I have experienced stripping out of the wood when driving them carelessly at top speed. I've used them primarily in pine, poplar, and birch, so I can't comment about other wood types like oak, ect. The cost of these screws decrease significantly when purchased in larger quantities. For my needs, they work perfectly...I would recommend them.

Input:
Easy to install; works as advertised and expected.

Two criticisms:
1) the remote switch is a single unit and cannot be placed into a regular gang box. It cannot be modified / customized. I wanted to place it next to an existing single pole switch by placing both the existing and the remote into a double gang box, but you can't do this.
2) the remote switch protrudes from the wall more than a normal switch - because it is a single unit and is surface mounted. I would like it better if they allowed for it to be placed in a gang box for flush mounting.

Input:
After having carpal tunnel surgery, I wanted something to help build up strength in my hands.  I remembered using a device similar to this several years ago.  After reading the description of the 4 models available I decided tghe Medium Tension model was what I needed.  I was wrong (or the maker description was wrong) since the device offers very little resistance.  I should have ordered the highest resistance model.

If you are a male and have any strength at all in your hands and fingers, this Medium Tension model is a waste of money.

Amazon has the best price that I could find.  When looking for anything I always check Amazon first.  It is surprising how many items they sell, and at very competitive prices.

Input:
My fans came with a remote, so they didn't come with pull chains.  Well, the remotes went out after about a year and a half.  I talked to the manufacturer, and of course it was just after the warranty had expired.  I could spend a bunch of money on a new remote/ receiver, or just stick this in the wall.  I had a switch for the light, and a switch for the fan on the wall.  So, I put a dimmer on the light switch, and this speed control on the fan switch leg.  it is perfect.  If you only have one switch leg, you probably don't want to use this.  If you have separate switch legs for the fan and light, it is great.

Input:
We love french cut green beans.  When buying canned green beans that is the only style we buy.  I grow  green beans whenever I can. but only recently discovered I could "french" my homegrown beans.  I read through the reviews and choose the Norpro Deluxe Bean Frencher.  I normally grow "Roma" type beans which are quite large and flat.  Unlike a lot of growers I let the beans mature to the point the beans inside are larger and the pods are a little tougher.  I have found that the frencher  readily handles two beans fairly well but it can be a little difficult to turn the handle.  Add any more pods and the frencher can jam  Using a different and  more tender type of bean would probably eliminate any jamming problems  So fsr the Norpro frencher is doing a really good job and turning out a good product.

Input:
I was originally pretty happy to be able to buy one of these for cheaper than what my college bookstore sells them for. I got the clicker okay, was able to use it but I guess I must have gotten a defective one because I started having serious problems being able to turn it on. Sometimes it wouldn't respond for a good 30 seconds before turning on and then when it did it would shut off quickly. Changing the batteries did not help. All kinds of problems and it ended up messing with my grades. This all happened a little too late for me to be able to return the product and I had to talk with my professor (who kindly traded me his). I know I'm one of the unlucky few who got a bad apple but I also think iclicker charges way too much for these remotes and should have some policy of dealing with students whose grades are affected by faulty products.

Input:
The Carter-style roller bearings were very simple to install and adjust. I was able to go through the entire process in about 45 minutes (and that included cleaning the sawdust from the parts of the saw I haven't seen in years). Changing adjustments for different blades is also a snap.

The saw now cuts perfectly. The saw stays on the line and cuts exactly where I want it to. Jet ought to make this device standard equipment for their bandsaws.

This replaced my old pressure cooker, and it is a great improvement.  I put chicken and pork in it, and in ten minutes it's done.  Be careful not to misplace the little thingamabobbin that goes on top and regulates the pressure.  I noticed that they sell replacements for this, so people probably do "lose" them.  Some assembly is required; you have to put the handles on with a screw driver.

Input:
After reading a number of previous reviews, I ordered the Large size instead of my normal Extra Large. Glad I did because the shirts (3) I ordered fit perfectly. I am 6', 215 with broad shoulders and about a 49" chest, the Large size shirt still has plenty of room for wearing a heavy undershirt and still be loose enough to be comfortable without binding. Afraid that if I had ordered Extra Large the shirts would be like wearing a tent. Maybe 5.11 put some extra into their sizing for those who may wear body armor.  Typical 5.11 quality- Built like a tank.  Highly Recommended.
Fast delivery.

Input:
I purchased this thermos to brew green and oolong tea with. It does exactly what it claims to do and keeps my tea and coffee nice and hot for what seems like forever. However, the thermos that I received leaks a lot. I'll tilt the thermos to drink from it, and it'll get all over my clothes, sheets and even keyboard. I've had to be very careful when I drink from this thermos. I'm not sure if the model that I received is defective, but at the price point, it's not worth going through the hassle to exchange.

Input: I got this Tiny Trike for my son when he was 8 months old, and, a whole year later, it continues to be a favorite. Only one reservation, and that is the bell. The bell that comes with the trike is cute, but pretty much impossible for children to make ring. You have to cock a hammer back and release it just so to get a "ping." My son was incredibly frustrated by it. We got rid of ours, and replaced it with a Incredibell Strawberry JelliBell, which comes in super cute colors and uses a simple turning mechanism to ring, instead. Options: ["A: very positive", "B: positive", "C: neutral", "D: negative", "E: very negative"]
